title: 109_s1410
content: The Act titled "Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Improvement Act of 2005" includes amendments to the Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Act. The Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Act is amended to include birds that breed in Canada and the United States, expand the definition of the Caribbean to include Puerto Rico and the United States Virgin Islands, and define the Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Fund. The Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Act is amended to include Canada in project proposals and increase cost sharing to 50 percent. Payment for projects in the United States and Canada must be made in cash. The Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Act is amended to allow the non-Federal share for projects in Latin America or the Caribbean to be paid in cash or in kind. Section 8 of the Act is further amended to include recommendations and a description of the advisory group's activities in the report. The Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Act is amended to include a description of the advisory group's activities. The Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Fund is addressed in Section 9. The Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Fund is established in the Treasury to receive donations and appropriations. Administrative expenses are increased to $150,000, and the Secretary of the Treasury is authorized to transfer funds. The Secretary of the Treasury will transfer funds to the Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Fund from the Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Account. Authorization of appropriations is amended to increase administrative expenses to $150,000. Authorization of appropriations for the Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Fund includes $5,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2006 and 2007, $8,000,000 for fiscal year 2008, and $10,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2009 and 2010. Amounts allocated must have at least 75 percent spent on projects outside the United States and remain available until expended.
